creditline: The Ethel Morrison Van Derlip Fund
description: Stirrup-handle jar with painted design of a mythical creature, half fish, half jaguar, in rust red on the panel of cream slip covering one half of the jar.
text: Moche pottery often illustrates fearsome beings of the other world. This figure combines human, jaguar, and marine animal elements to show its supernatural character. The snarling mouth and sacrificial tumi blade depicted in its outstretched hand emphasize its potentially dangerous nature.
title: Vessel
